pages.text: Although their names were lost to time, the old practitioners of my art were often known for a color, emblematic of them and their spells. It seems a special kind of pigment, offered to Nature in the right way, would "[...] paint one's thoughts in a manner pleasing to Nature, inducing a miraculous change in color."

I'm not certain on the specifics of how it works, but I believe I have isolated the formulae for many different colors of pigments. To use one, I hold it in my other hand while casting $(l:patterns/spells/colorize)$(action)Internalize Pigment/$, which will consume the pigment and mark my mind with that color.$(br2)The pigments seem to affect the color of the spare media coming out of a staff when I cast a _Hex, as well as my $(l:hexcasting/patterns/sentinels)$(thing)Sentinel/$.

pages.heading: Chromatic Colorizers
pages.text: Pigments all the colors of the rainbow.
And finally, a pigment with a color wholly unique to me.$(br2)$(italic)And all the colors I am inside have not been invented yet./$
